page.title: 14SOCIAL CONCERNS - TRAFFIC
page.content: ONE OF THE MAIN SOCIAL CONCERNS OF THE PEOPLE WE CONSULTED WAS THE TRAFFIC CONGESTION ON THE BUSY A3. THEY FOUND THE PROBLEM TO BE AT ITS WORST DURING THE MORNING AND EVENING RUSH HOURS, 8-9AM, AND 4-6PM, AND DURING THE SUMMER MONTHS WHEN HOLIDAY TRAFFIC ADDS TO THE CONGESTION. THE PROBLEM HAS BEEN FURTHER AGGRAVATED BY THE INCREASED USE OF PORTSMOUTH AS A CROSS CHANNEL PORT. HEAVY CONTINENTAL LORRIES ARE A FREQUENT SIGHT GRINDING UP THE A3 THROUGH HINDHEAD. WHILE MANY LOCAL RESIDENTS COMPLAINED ABOUT THE PROBLEM THERE WAS NO CLEAR CONSENSUS AS TO WHICH OF THE MANY ROAD IMPROVEMENT SCHEMES SHOULD BE ADOPTED. THERE IS MUCH CONCERN THAT ANY ROAD IMPROVEMENT PROGRAMME WOULD INEVITABLY DESTROY A LARGE AREA OF THE ADJACENT COMMONLAND AND THE BEAUTY OF THE AREA.
